summary.body: A planning application for change of colour for external redecorations has arrived today in Ben Jonson.  I opened it thinking....please god...anything but red. And of course it's red.  Does anyone know why it has to change, and if so who chooses the colour and why? I have a huge personal dislike of red ... some primeval fear of the colour possibly ... this is actually a huge deal to me although I appreciate it probably doesn't bother most people.   Why mess with something that looks so good as it is? And surely it's harder to change the colour than simply to redecorate with the same shade.  Or maybe the intention is to make sure that the job is done well, so the colour change is a good way of checking it's all been done? I may have to move
summary.subject: Paintwork - change of colour for BJH

summary.body: Hello I am an interloper so I hope it's okay to ask this.  I don't live in the Barbican yet and perhaps never will (as you all no doubt know, there is a dearth of properties) but I wondered if any of you would be generous enough to share your thoughts on living there and good points/bad points. I've lived in flats all my life (we currently live near Old Street and hurrah for the new Waitrose even if, yes, some of the staff are very incongruous for JLP) so I know that properties can differ wildly and that it's also a matter of personal choice. But these are the things I'd like to ask (in no particular order): Am I correct in thinking the biggest flats are in the towers? Is it generally a quiet and safe place to live or does it vary wildly from block to block? What's it like for children? The private gardens seem amazing but in reality what's it like? Is the service charge astronomical (I realise it depends on size of flat)? What will happen when all TV goes digital and the Barbican has no digital cable?? Is the listed building classification a pain if you want to do any work in the flat? Garchey, good or bad? Are parking places readily available to rent or is there a shortage? Anything to look for that an outsider may not know about.  I'd be really grateful for any answers. If I can reciprocate in any way...my specialities are fly fishing, beauty products, nutrition and fashion. I know, ecletic and slightly bizarre! Thank you. AB
summary.subject: What's it like living in the Barbican?

summary.body: For the second time in only a couple of months my onetel email service is down and I've been able neither to send or receive anything for several days. Their customer service number responds only with fax bleeps and their technical helpline goes through to a person who says she is not onetel. Of course there is no connection to be made with Mailzone through the Onetel website. I finally contacted Carphone Warehouse, who took over Talktalk/onetel a while ago and was put through to a customer service line for onetel, only to be told they were aware of a problem and were working on it. I was given an  status update number to check progress. Guess what? This number hangs up with a continuous bleep, so no joy there. Is my immediate solution to open a hotmail account? Is it as easy as it looks on the sign up page? As a Microsoft Windows system, is it compatible with my iMac?
summary.subject: onetel hell!

summary.body: Hello everyone,  We love the Barbican and have been renting here for a while but now want to buy. But what is it actually like to live there?
